comments.author: jruderman@gmail.com
comments.creator: jruderman@gmail.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 580697
testcase (asserts fatally when loaded)

###!!! ABORT: must call nsHTMLReflowState& version during reflow: '!(f->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_IN_REFLOW)', file layout/base/nsLayoutUtils.cpp, line 4772

This is the same abort as in bug 708036, but the testcase and stack seem different.

comments.creator: dbaron@dbaron.org
comments.author: dbaron@dbaron.org
comments.raw_text: I think errors during reflow are causing the nsColumnSetFrame to not have its NS_FRAME_IN_REFLOW bit cleared at the end of reflow.
comments.text: I think errors during reflow are causing the nsColumnSetFrame to not have its NS_FRAME_IN_REFLOW bit cleared at the end of reflow.

comments.raw_text: Automation reproduced this with the same stack at http://fishki.net/comment.php?id=106840 on 32bit and 64 bit Linux Beta/11, Aurora/12, Nightly/13 but I can't reproduce it locally.
comments.text: Automation reproduced this with the same stack at http://fishki.net/comment.php?id=106840 on 32bit and 64 bit Linux Beta/11, Aurora/12, Nightly/13 but I can't reproduce it locally.

comments.raw_text: Nope. We should drop the leave-open keyword here, though. (It only serves a purpose for a short period after a landing to prevent the auto-closing.)
